title: About
text: COMMUNITY SERVICE & EXTRACURRICULARS Hermanos Unidos de UCLA - Social Chair & Alumni Liasson Intern| Los Angeles, CA September 2021 â€“ Present - Hosted professional development workshops for 40+ members interested in the importance of networking - Led Interactive tours of the UCLA campus for low-income high school and middle school students, promoting higher education among minority communities - Developed a database containing the information of hundreds of alumni organized by occupation, allowing 70+ members to easily locate and network within their academic sectors

title: projects
text:
Project
Predicting Obesity Status
Within this project, our primary goal persisted of applying exploratory analysis on a data set which consisted of dozens of factors dedicated towards predicting obesity. Through the use of prediction models on training data tsets, we were able to transform our methods into training data sets which supported by classification reports and analysis predicted obesity status.
Working with my designated teammates, my role within the project attended to the exploratory analysis to which I implemented multiple models. The primary focus was set on random forest models which extended to and Extreme Gradient Boosting approach that ultimately achieved a 98% accuracy level towards correctly predicting obesity status.

title: Gerardo Munoz
text: Gerardo Munoz is a 4th year Statistics & Data Science student interested in pursuing a career within the medical field. Applying statistical knowledge through machine learning techniques has fostered his interest towards researching heritable diseases within the hispanic community. Download My Resume.
